channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: In newly released testimony, Jack Smith defends his investigations into Trump
item.description: Former special counsel Jack Smith spoke with lawmakers behind closed doors in December. That testimony is now public.
item.content:encoded: Former special counsel Jack Smith spoke with lawmakers behind closed doors in December. That testimony is now public.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Mobile crisis teams shut down amid funding troubles
item.description: In recent years, mobile crisis response teams respond to 911 calls about people in mental crisis, to avoid involving police. But some crisis units have now closed for lack of consistent funding.
item.content:encoded: In recent years, mobile crisis response teams respond to 911 calls about people in mental crisis, to avoid involving police. But some crisis units have now closed for lack of consistent funding.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bolton

item.title: California study has lessons for efforts to protect workers from excessive heat
item.description: A new study finds that California's rules protecting workers from excessive heat likely save dozens of lives every year. This comes as the federal government considers national heat-protection rules.
item.content:encoded: A new study finds that California's rules protecting workers from excessive heat likely save dozens of lives every year. This comes as the federal government considers national heat-protection rules.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: Thousands of people turn out for NYC Mayor Mamdani's inauguration
item.description: New York City has a new mayor. Zohran Mamdani is the city's first Muslim mayor and a democratic socialist.
item.content:encoded: New York City has a new mayor. Zohran Mamdani is the city's first Muslim mayor and a democratic socialist.
item.dc:creator: Brigid Bergin

item.title: Congress failed to extend Obamacare subsidies. This Democrat says Trump can save them
item.description: Sen. Peter Welch, D-Vt., says he thinks the Senate can pass a "retroactive" Affordable Care Act subsidy extension, but "we need President Trump."
item.content:encoded:
Sen. Peter Welch, D-Vt., says he thinks the Senate can pass a "retroactive" Affordable Care Act subsidy extension, but "we need President Trump."

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Rideshare union rights, social media limits and other state laws taking effect Jan. 1
item.description: Every new year, public media reporters across the country bring us some of the new state laws taking effect where they are. Here are six in 2026.
item.content:encoded:
Every new year, public media reporters across the country bring us some of the new state laws taking effect where they are. Here are six in 2026.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Laura Fitzgerald

item.title: Affordable Care Act subsidies have expired. What that means for millions of Americans
item.description: Jan. 1 is the day the extra financial help to buy Affordable Care Act health insurance goes away.
item.content:encoded: Jan. 1 is the day the extra financial help to buy Affordable Care Act health insurance goes away.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: Warren Buffett officially retires as Berkshire Hathaway's CEO
item.description: The legendary 95-year-old investor spent decades building his company into one of the world's largest and most powerful. Now Greg Abel is taking it over.
item.content:encoded:
The legendary 95-year-old investor spent decades building his company into one of the world's largest and most powerful. Now Greg Abel is taking it over.

(Image credit: Chandan Khanna)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The Affordable Care Act subsidies have expired, Trump administration freezes Minnesota childcare funds after claims of fraud, Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City mayor.
item.content:encoded: The Affordable Care Act subsidies have expired, Trump administration freezes Minnesota childcare funds after claims of fraud, Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City mayor.
item.dc:creator: A Mart√≠nez

item.title: Some of the cultural works entering the public domain in 2026
item.description: A look at some of the works going into the public domain in 2026, like the characters Betty Boop and Miss Marple, the first film adaptation of "All Quiet on the Western Front" and many classic songs by George & Ira Gershwin.
item.content:encoded: A look at some of the works going into the public domain in 2026, like the characters Betty Boop and Miss Marple, the first film adaptation of "All Quiet on the Western Front" and many classic songs by George & Ira Gershwin.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
